com.emmes.aps

Class ReminderNotification

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • com.emmes.aps.ReminderNotification

  • public class ReminderNotification
extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver
    The Class ReminderNotification is for creating different type of notification the user will get based on the local settings of APS app.

    This is a receiver class which will receive the alarm notification of four different types of notification 1. Diary 2. Nitro 3. AM peak flow and 4. PM peak flow. For different type of notification, the message will be provided based on that. So, while receiving the alarm, it will find out the message from list, and will build a notification. The notification will target to the pin activity.

    For each type of notification, different request code is provided

      • setNotificationAlarm

        public void setNotificationAlarm(android.content.Context aContext,
                        int requestCode,
                        long lastcollection)
        Sets the recurring alarm(Currently not using in the program).

        Algorithm:
        The process works here as

        • For all kinds of alarms from the form content, the next alarm time is defined without recurrence.
        • Flag_cancel is selected, so if the next alarm is reset, previous alarm should be canceled if exists
        • Make sure that alarm is not canceled as soon as the devices shut down.
        • Frequency of certain alarm is retrieved from database by query specific types of notification.
        • Next alarm time is defined using Frequency* day + lastcollection (all of the case, it should be now).
        Parameters:
        aContext - which context the alarm will be settled
        requestCode - for each type of alarm, there should have unique requestCode.
        lastcollection - as the notification will be set while the work is done which also keeps track of last time taken time. Based on that the system can calculate the next alarm time.

      • willNotifyUser

        private boolean willNotifyUser()
        This method will decide whether to generate notification for the user or not. If need to generate notification, then what type of message should be included and what not to be included.

        The method will decide about four types of notification condition for the next notification message. If one item information is submitted for the day then that message should not be included to the notification. This will also add all the message together for notification and update the @link com.emmes.aps.ReminderNotification#mNotificationMsg which will be displayed to the user as notification.

        Procedure

        • Retrieve frequency and last collection time from database for each type of form from the database table
        • if frequency is greater than 0, then add number of days equal to frequency with the last collected calendar object
        • Compare result date object with current date
        • If current date and updated last collected date is today or earlier, add notification to the message. Otherwise ignore message
        • Return true if any one of those are true otherwise return false.
        Returns:
        true, if any of the four notification have to be send to the user.

      • setRepeatingReminder

        public static void setRepeatingReminder(android.content.Context context,
                        int alarmCode)
        This static method will start the recurring alarm for reminder.

        This method will create repeating alarm daily basis. It will accept the argument of alarmStart time which will determine when the alarm will first appear and alarmCode which will represents different alarms. As we have morning alarm and evening alarm, we need two different alarmCode.

        Parameters:
        context - which context the alarm will use to produce
        alarmCode - we have two types of alarm, morning alarm and evening alarm, for each alarm two separate code should be provided to create multiple alarm.

      • stopRecurringAlarm

        private static void stopRecurringAlarm(android.content.Context context,
                      int alarmCode)
        Stop recurring alarm.
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        alarmCode - the alarm code
